source.title: PET within 7 years but below NRB - no taper applies

testCase.description: Gift within 7 years but below NRB - no tax, taper relief does not apply
testCase.scenario: Albert makes a gift of £300,000 on 1 February 2009 and dies on 20 June 2012. The gift is within 7 years but its value is below the NRB at death. No tax is due, so taper relief does not apply.

calculationNotes: Gift is within 7 years, so PET fails and becomes chargeable
Since gift does not exceed NRB, there is no tax directly attributable to the gift
Therefore, taper relief does not apply (nothing to taper)
Key principle: Taper relief only applies if there is tax to reduce
Taper relief reduces TAX, not the gift value for cumulation
No estate assets in this example
hmrcQuote: Albert makes a gift of £300,000 on 1 February 2009 and dies on 20 June 2012. The gift is over three years from the date of death, but its value is below the IHT nil-rate band at the date of death. There is no tax directly attributable to the gift and so no taper relief applies.
